question.text: Draw 4 consecutive whole notes. Use any clef and time signature.
question.hint: A whole note consists of a hollow oval-shaped notehead that is long-wise horizontal, and is positioned either between two lines or over the middle of a line. In 4/4 time, a whole note has a duration of four beats.

question.text: Draw 4 consecutive half notes. Use any clef and time signature.
question.hint: A half note is visually similar to a whole note, except that it contains a connecting line called a stem. If the half note is above the middle line, its stem faces down and on the left of the notehead. Below, and its stem faces up and on the right of the notehead. On, and the stem can go either way. In 4/4 time, a half note has a duration of two beats.

question.text: Draw 4 consecutive quarter notes. Use any clef and time signature.
question.hint: A quarter note is visually similar to a half note, except that its notehead is filled. Stems are written in the same way as for half notes. In 4/4 time, a quarter note has a duration of one beat.

question.text: Draw 4 consecutive eighth notes with either flags or beams. Use any clef and time signature.
question.hint: An eighth note is visually similar to a quarter note, except that its stem contains either a flag or a beam. A flag connects at the stem end, curves right, and faces towards the notehead. A beam is a straight line that connects between consecutive eighth notes. In 4/4 time, an eighth note has a duration of half a beat.

question.text: Draw dotted versions of a whole, half, quarter, and eighth note in consecutive order. Use any clef and time signature.
question.hint: The dot of a dotted note appears to the right of a note. Its use increases the duration of a note by half of the note's value.

question.text: Draw interchanging whole notes and whole rests twice. Use any clef and time signature.
question.hint: A whole rest is a filled rectangle that lies underneath the second line from the top. It visually looks like an upside-down top hat. In 4/4 time, a whole rest has a duration of four beats.

question.text: Draw interchanging half notes and half rests twice. Use any clef and time signature.
question.hint: A half rest is a filled rectangle that lies above the third line from the top. It visually looks like a top hat. In 4/4 time, a half rest has a duration of two beats.

question.text: Draw interchanging quarter notes and quarter rests twice. Use any clef and time signature.
question.hint: A quarter rest visually looks like a squibbly z and c stacked on top of each other that stretches from the second to the fourth lines of the staff. In 4/4 time, a quarter rest has a duration of one beat.

question.text: Draw interchanging eighth notes and eighth rests twice. Use any clef and time signature.
question.hint: An eighth rest visually looks like a cursive 'y' that stretches from the second to the fourth lines of the staff. In 4/4 time, a whole rest has a duration of one beat. In 4/4 time, an eighth rest has a duration of half a beat.
